body_html:
@mrry and @chrisruk, at least one possibility here. The first root error, "Attempting to use uninitialized value convolution2d_1_W_1", appears due to an uninitialized Tensor.

While I do see the model code setting the init_op, I don't see it passed to the model_exporter. As-is, the exporter will not set an init_op on the model export, so at load time the init_op will not be called.

To try this fix (setting the init_op), please add the "init_op=init_op," line as below:

model_exporter.init(
sess.graph.as_graph_def(),
init_op=init_op,
... / other params
)
body_text:
@mrry and @chrisruk, at least one possibility here. The first root error, "Attempting to use uninitialized value convolution2d_1_W_1", appears due to an uninitialized Tensor.
While I do see the model code setting the init_op, I don't see it passed to the model_exporter. As-is, the exporter will not set an init_op on the model export, so at load time the init_op will not be called.
To try this fix (setting the init_op), please add the "init_op=init_op," line as below:
model_exporter.init(
sess.graph.as_graph_def(),
init_op=init_op,
... / other params
)
body:
@mrry and @chrisruk, at least one possibility here. The first root error, "Attempting to use uninitialized value convolution2d_1_W_1", appears due to an uninitialized Tensor. 

While I do see the model code setting the init_op, I don't see it passed to the model_exporter. As-is, the exporter will not set an init_op on the model export, so at load time the init_op will not be called.

To try this fix (setting the init_op), please add the "init_op=init_op," line as below:

model_exporter.init(
      sess.graph.as_graph_def(),
      **init_op=init_op**,
      ... / other params
)
